Want glowing skin after 40? Add this to your diet daily
Nutritionist reveals the best flaxseed hacks for women’s health
Smoothie boost
Ground flaxseeds blend seamlessly into smoothies, adding bulk without altering the flavor much. Just one spoon in your morning smoothie
Salad sprinkle
Sprinkling flaxseeds over salads or soups is one of the easiest ways to use them. They add a nutty crunch that enhances both taste and texture. Beyond flavor, you get extra fiber, which aids digestion and helps keep blood sugar stable. This works for quick weekday salads, hearty bowls, or even warm comforting soups.
Roti upgrade
Mixing flaxseeds into
Yogurt mix
Flaxseeds stirred into Greek yogurt, curd, or overnight oats create a wholesome snack or breakfast. The seeds add texture while keeping you full for longer due to their fiber content. Combined with probiotics in yogurt, this duo supports gut health beautifully. It’s simple, nourishing, and perfect for busy mornings.
Flaxseed chutney
Flaxseed chutney is one of the most creative and versatile ways to add this superfood to your diet. It’s tangy, spicy, and pairs well with almost every Indian dish. Unlike plain flaxseeds, chutney gives them a burst of flavor that makes it easy to enjoy daily.
Easy recipe
To make this chutney, roast 4 tablespoons of flaxseeds until fragrant. Add 2-3 garlic cloves, 2 dry red chilies, and a pinch of salt. Grind everything into a coarse powder and store it in an airtight jar. This chutney is quick, healthy, and the perfect condiment to keep handy in every kitchen.
Final Note
